intro: Cynanchum veleziae, commonly known as the Velez's dogbane, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, often with a hairy texture. Cynanchum veleziae is adapted to high-altitude environments and is typically found in rocky or mountainous habitats.
